thread.title: 7 images of Gareth Southgate from Germany defeat which sum up the life of an England manager
thread.title_full: 7 images of Gareth Southgate from Germany defeat which sum up the life of an England manager

author: Mark Jones
title: 7 images of Gareth Southgate from Germany defeat which sum up the life of an England manager
text:
Sport 7 images of Gareth Southgate from Germany defeat which sum up the life of an England manager England did alright for the vast majority of the game in Dortmund, but as they ultimately suffered defeat, their manager felt the same emotions that so many before him have experienced Share "It wasn't this hard at Middlesbrough. We did get relegated, mind" (Photo: Shaun Botterill) Share Get daily   
It was only a friendly, but England will take great heart from the way they played against Germany in Dortmund on Wednesday evening. 
Manager Gareth Southgate tried out a new formation featuring three central defenders, and for the most part it worked, with England keeping the hosts at bay and even coming close to scoring on a couple of occasions. 
They still lost in the end, though. 
Lukas Podolski's brilliant winner on his final international appearance settled the clash in the hosts' favour, and left Southgate with much to think about ahead of Sunday's World Cup qualifier against Lithuania. He's still there now (Photo: Maja Hitij) 
But how did the evening unfold for the new England boss? 
Take a step into his world. Before the game, he learned a valuable lesson about what life is like when you're the boss "Are they laughing at me? They're laughing a me aren't they? Why are they laughing at me?" (Photo: Shaun Botterill) But he didn't let the game put him off from his real goal as England manager - a spot in one of those Burton ads they like to trot out before a major tournament " nd BLUE STEEL"   He made sure he sang the anthem, which is VERY important "...happy and glorious, long to..." (Photo: Michael Regan - The FA) Then when the game started, he tried to perfect his new "hard man" persona "I watched three-quarters of an episode of Ross Kemp on Gangs last night, so I think I've got the hang of it" (Photo: Michael Regan - The FA) He made sure he encouraged the players "Joe. Joe! Like this, yeah?" (Photo: Michael Regan - The FA) And he was steadfast in his approach "Round thing. Goal. Right?" (Photo: PA Wire) But sure enough, he soon experienced the one thing which is inevitable for any England manager (except Sam Allardyce) - defeat "Anyone fancy a pint of wine?" (Photo: Shaun Botterill) 
Hopefully Sunday's clash with Lithuania is a happier occasion for him. 
And he brings out the Blue Steel again. poll loading Will Gareth Southgate be a success with England? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
